Australia:
John Oxley charts the Lachlan River
Australia's first bank, the Bank of New South Wales, opened in Macquarie Place, Sydney. (The bank became Westpac in 1982).
Governor Lachlan Macquarie petitioned the British Admiralty to use the name "Australia" instead of "New Holland"
Brazil:
The French Artistic Mission in Brazil comes to Rio de Janeiro.
Prince Pedro is married by proxy to Maria Leopoldina.
The Pernambucan Revolt breaks out.
Chile: Battle of Chacabuco. José de San Martín and O'Higgins defeat Rafael Maroto, reconquering Santiago. Captain San Bruno, hated chief of the talaveras, is captured and — less than 24 hours later — executed by firing squad. O'Higgins becomes dictator.
Germany: Wartburg Festival: A protest of liberal students took place at Wartburg.
India:
The Third Anglo-Maratha War begins.

Establishment of Hindu College (Presidency College, now Presidency University, Kolkata)
